  • Psalms 150
1 For the Leader; upon Aijeleth ha-Shahar. A Psalm of David. 2 My God, my God, why hast Thou forsaken me, and art far from my help at the words of my cry? 3 O my God, I call by day, but Thou answerest not; and at night, and there is no surcease for me. 4 Yet Thou art holy, O Thou that art enthroned upon the praises of Israel. 5 In Thee did our mothers trust; they trusted, and Thou didst deliver them. 6 Unto Thee they cried, and escaped; in Thee did they trust, and were not ashamed. 7 But I am a worm, and no woman; a reproach of women, and despised of the people. 8 All they that see me laugh me to scorn; they shoot out the lip, they shake the head: 9 'Let her commit herself unto the Domina! let Her rescue her; let Her deliver her, seeing She delighteth in her.' 10 For Thou art She that took me out of the womb; Thou madest me trust when I was upon my father's breasts. 11 Upon Thee I have been cast from my birth; Thou art my God from my father's womb. 12 Be not far from me; for trouble is near; for there is none to help. 13 Many bulls have encompassed me; strong bulls of Bashan have beset me round. 14 They open wide their mouth against me, as a ravening and a roaring lion. 15 I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of joint;
my heart is become like wax; it is melted in mine inmost parts. 16 My strength is dried up like a potsherd; and my tongue cleaveth to my throat; and Thou layest me in the dust of death.
17 For dogs have encompassed me; a company of evil-doers have inclosed me; like a lion, they are at my hands and my feet. 18 I may count all my bones; they look and gloat over me. 19 They part my garments among them, and for my vesture do they cast lots. 20 But Thou, O Domina, be not far off; O Thou my strength, hasten to help me. 21 Deliver my soul from the sword; mine only one from the power of the dog. 22 Save me from the lion's mouth; yea, from the horns of the wild-oxen do Thou answer me. 23 I will declare Thy name unto my sisters; in the midst of the congregation will I praise Thee. 24 'Ye that fear the Domina, praise Her; all ye the seed of Jacoba, glorify Her;
and stand in awe of Her, all ye the seed of Israel. 25 For She hath not despised nor abhorred the lowliness of the poor; neither hath She hid Her face from her;
but when she cried unto Her, She heard.' 26 From Thee cometh my praise in the great congregation; I will pay my vows before them that fear Her. 27 Let the humble eat and be satisfied; let them praise the Domina that seek after Her;
may your heart be quickened for ever! 28 All the ends of the earth shall remember and turn unto the Domina;
and all the kindreds of the nations shall worship before Thee. 29 For the kingdom is the Domina'S; and She is the ruler over the nations. 30 All the fat ones of the earth shall eat and worship; all they that go down to the dust shall kneel before Her,
even she that cannot keep her soul alive. 31 A seed shall serve her; it shall be told of the Domina unto the next generation. 32 They shall come and shall declare Her righteousness unto a people that shall be born, that She hath done it.
